result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony LaSalle McIntosh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony LaSalle McIntosh was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Anthony LaSalle McIntosh was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony LaSalle McIntosh

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 110 DAYS in the House of Correction, Concurrent to COUNT 3, with credit for 110 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 
  
AS TO COUNT 3:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 110 DAYS in the House of Correction, Concurrent to COUNT 2, with credit for 110 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court set Restitution at ZERO.

Court ordered Defendant to provide to pay DNA Surcharge by March 13, 2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; PreTrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Anthony LaSalle McIntosh.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2 and COUNT 3: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
PreTrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights; received and filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights; received and filed.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding resolution and joint recommendation. 
Court CONVERTED Final PreTrial to Plea/Sentencing hearing). 
If the Court is not able to proceed to Sentencing, Court will address bail. 
Plea/Sentencing hearing (or Bail hearing) scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

COURT LOWERED CASH BAIL TO $7,500.00.
 All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

11:30 AM Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

 **JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Case adjourned for FInal PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Bail/ Bond Review, Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Bail Review, Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Final PreTrial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 8:45 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Jury Trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in Court, Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense has NOT received complete discovery material from the State. Court ordered Defense and State to meet at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Due to the nature of the charges, case belongs in GUN COURT - BRANCH 46.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court, appear by video with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Narlock.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Date provided by Judge Shelton clerk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Alonja V.; Larell S. V.; Keyshawn A. W.; 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony LaSalle McIntosh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2 and count 3.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
